item.title: Huge pothole, over 3 feet wide and maybe 5 inches deep. Completely knackered my tyre., 30th January
item.description:
This pothole has been here for at least 6 weeks. Itâ€™s on Birdlip hill and has been growing rapidly. The postcode of the stretch of road is GL3 4SL. It is about 100 meters before the two houses that sit just after the forested area shown on the map.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Green Lane, Witcombe

item.description:
Extreamly bad pot hole/ road defect !!! People go round and going to cause an issue Needs action as been a long time

item.title: Large sunken section of road extreamly deep, 29th January
item.description:
Sunken section of road , extreamly deep and vehicles go round it to avoid big suspension bangs ,this causes a danger and risk to other road users as right on a roundabout. Extreamly dangourous for motor vehicles and 2 wheeled vehicles . Clearly this section of road not been inspected for a considerable amount of time . 20 jan 2021
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 77 Village Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road in v bad condition, 29th January
item.description:
Hello - I was cyling along this road and had to keep swerving to avoid v bad road surface. cars coming the other way were doing the same thing so it had become dangerous and it will only get worse as the new school build progresses. Please could this road be looked at before an accident happens? many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lantern Lodge Farm Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous footpath, 29th January
item.description:
The footpath between Nos. 2 and 4 Willersey Road, Benhall, Cheltenam is very dangerous. There are very uneven slabs and large gaps between them. Serious trip hazzard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Willersey Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drains, been blocked for many months!, 29th January
item.description:
There are more than five road drains completely blocked on the roadside going down Prestbury road towards town from Priors road exit down to The roundabout.This is not covered with leaves and other rubbish but completely blocked with water sitting on top of them. There are also several in the same state on the other side of the road coming up from Pitville Circus roundabout towards and past the garage, in particular both sides of the pedestrian lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Capel House The Burgage, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent dangerous parking, 29th January
item.description:
There are always cars and vans parked the length of this road, being a blind bend it is difficult to drive around them and see what's coming ahead. I Hve to use this toad daily and have had several near-misses. Would be difficult for emergency vehicles to pass this stretch of road too. Ideally a traffic warden needs to be in this area!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole in mill sreet Prestbury opposite the plough public house, 29th January
item.description:
There are several pot holes alongside the wall of St Maryâ€™s Church Prestbury in Mill street opposite the plough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Capel House The Burgage, Prestbury

item.title: Fly Tipping / Rubbish around the Pylons Car Park Cleeve Common Road, 29th January
item.description:
The location is near the rubbish bins at the Pylons Car Park at the end of the Cleeve Common Road. A car mat left by the bins was not collected when the bins were emptied. The car park area from the common and back down the road as far as the entrance to the Butterfly Field has a quantity of rubbish acculmulated around it. Please can a litter pick and collection of material in this are be done please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mod Communication Site Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip of some clothes and other Material at the Location, 29th January
item.description:
The location is on the right hand side going up Cleeve Common Road - just at the top of the first hill where the road widens and there is an entrance / lay by/ passing place just past a wooded area. The material has been dumped by the wall in this area. Please can it be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Fly Tips in Entrance to Old Quarry Cleeve Common Road, 29th January
item.description:
A burning fly tip was noted at the location - Old Quarry Entrance off Cleeve Common Road - two days ago. However, aq further tip consisting of packaging and polystyrene packaging has appeared over night. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible or the light polystyrene could be blown around the area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked on pavement, was parked there all day yesterday, 29th January
item.description:
These two vans are parked on double yellow lines and the white van was parked there from 8am to 6pm yesterday.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Suffolk Villas Suffolk Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on Queens Road, AGAIN, 29th January
item.description:
Yet again the large road gully outside Queensbridge Care Home, in Queens Road, is blocked. Latest issue has existed for a couple of months and every time there is any reasonable amount of rain the road floods, and it then takes several days to dry up completely. As of 8am today the flood is almost to the centre line on the road, plus is halfway across the pavement. It is a danger to highways traffic, and also footpath traffic. Yet again this gully needs urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 82 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
